member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.BuiltInDocumentProperties
member.summary: A collection of built-in document properties.

remarks.p: Provides access to objects by their names (using an indexer) and via a set of typed properties that return values of appropriate types.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.DocumentProperties
member.summary: Base class for and collections.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.DocumentProperties.Contains(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if a property with the specified name exists in the collection.
member.param: The case-insensitive name of the property.
member.returns: True if the property exists in the collection; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.DocumentProperties.IndexOf(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the index of a property by name.
member.param: The case-insensitive name of the property.
member.returns: The zero based index. Negative value if not found.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.DocumentProperties.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a property with the specified name from the collection.
member.param: The case-insensitive name of the property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.DocumentProperties.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a property at the specified index.
member.param: The zero based index.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.DocumentProperties.Clear
member.summary: Removes all properties from the collection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.DocumentProperties.Count
member.summary: Gets number of items in the collection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.DocumentProperties.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a object by the name of the property.

remarks.p: Returns null if a property with the specified name is not found.

member.param: The case-insensitive name of the property to retrieve.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.DocumentProperties.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a object by index.
member.param: Zero-based index of the to retrieve.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.BuiltInDocumentProperties.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a object by the name of the property.

remarks.p: The string names of the properties correspond to the names of the typed properties available from .

If you request a property that is not present in the document, but the name of the property is recognized as a valid built-in name, a new is created, added to the collection and returned. The newly created property is assigned a default value (empty string, zero, false or DateTime.MinValue depending on the type of the built-in property).
If you request a property that is not present in the document and the name is not recognized as a built-in name, a null is returned.

member.param: The case-insensitive name of the property to retrieve.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PivotPageFields.AddIdentify(System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Sets which item label in each page field to use to identify the data range. The pageItemIndex.Length must be equal to PageFieldCount, so please add the page field first.
member.param: The consilidation data range index.

The page item index in the each page field. pageItemIndex[2] = 1 means the seconde item in the third field to use to identify this range. pageItemIndex[1] = -1 means no item in the second field to use to identify this range and MS will auto create "blank" item in the second field to identify this range.

members.member:
Gets or sets the of the object.
NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, you should use and for the same purpose. These two new methods optimize speed and memory usage for applying formattings on a large amount of cells. This property will be removed 12 months later since March 2008. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced. [Obsolete("Use Cell.GetStyle() and Cell.SetStyle() method instead.")]

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Cell.Formula
member.summary: Gets or sets a formula of the .
member.remarks:
A formula string always begins with an equal sign (=). And please always use comma(,) as parameters delimeter, such as "=SUM(A1, E1, H2)".
User can set any formula in Workbook designer file. Aspose.Cells will keep all the formulas. If user use this property to set a formula to a cell, major part of Workbook built-in functions is supported. And more is coming. If you have any special need for Workbook built-in functions, please let us know.
Now Workbook built-in functions supported by Aspose.Cells:
[A]
ABS, ACOS, ACOSH, ADDRESS, AND, ASC, ASIN, ASINH, ATAN, ATAN2, ATANH, AVEDEV, AVERAGE,AVERAGEA
[B] BETADIST, BETAINV, BINOMDIST
[C]
CEILING, CELL, CHAR, CODE, COLUMN, COLUMNS, COMBIN, CONCATENATE, CORREL, COS, COSH, COUNT, COUNTA, COUNTBLANK, COUNTIF
[D]
DATE, DATEDIF, DATEVALUE, DAVERAGE, DAY, DAYS360, DCOUNT, DCOUNTA, DDB, DEGREES, DGET, DMAX, DMIN, DOLLAR, DPRODUCT,
DSTDEV, DSTDEVP, DSUM, DVAR, DVARP
[E]
EVEN, EXACT, EXP, EXPONDIST
[F]
FACT, FALSE, FIND, FIXED, FLOOR, FORECAST, FREQUENCY, FTEST, FV
[G]
GETPIVOTDATA
[H]
HLOOKUP, HOUR, HYPERLINK
[I]
IF, INDEX, INDIRECT, IPMT, INT, IRR, ISBLANK, ISERR, ISERROR, ISNA, ISNUMBER, ISREF
[L]
LEFT, LEN, LINEST, LN, LOG, LOG10, LOGEST, LOOKUP, LOWER
[M]
MATCH, MAX, MEDIAN, MID, MIN, MINUTE, MIRR, MMULT, MOD, MONTH
[N]
N, NA, NORMDIST,NORMINV, NORMSDIST, NORMSINV, NOT, NOW, NPER, NPV
[O]
ODD, OFFSET,OR
[P]

members.member:
Gets the collection of objects that represents the individual rows in this worksheet.
NOTE: This member is now obsolete. It will be removed 12 months later since the fix 4.4.1.8 in March 2008. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced. [Obsolete]

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Cells.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets cell items within the worksheet
member.param: The zero based index of the element.
member.value: The element at the specified index.
member.remarks: This is the indexer for the Cells class. Gets the cell element at the specified index.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Cells.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the element at the specified cell row index and column index.
member.param: Row index.
Column index.

example.code:
[C#]
Cells cells = excel.Worksheets[0].Cells; Cell cell = cells[0, 0]; //Gets the cell at "A1"
[Visual Basic]
Dim cells As Cells = excel.Worksheets(0).Cells Dim cell As Cell = cells(0,0) 'Gets the cell at "A1"

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Cells.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the element at the specified cell name.
member.param: Cell name,including its column letter and row number, for example A5.

example.code:
[C#]
Cells cells = excel.Worksheets[0].Cells; Cell cell = cells["A1"]; //Gets the cell at "A1"
[Visual Basic]
Dim cells As Cells = excel.Worksheets(0).Cells Dim cell As Cell = cells("A1") 'Gets the cell at "A1"

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Chart.ToImage
member.summary: Gets the picture of the chart.
member.remarks: If the width or height is zero, return null. Now only supports to convert 2D chart to image. If the chart is 3D chart,return null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Chart.ToImage(System.String)
member.overloads: Creates the chart image and saves it.
member.summary: Creates the chart image and saves it to a file.
member.param: The image file name with full path.

remarks.p: The format of the image is specified using the extension of the file name. For example, if you specify "myfile.png", then the image will be saved in the PNG format. The following file extensions are recognized: .bmp, .gif, .jpg, .jpeg, .tiff, .emf.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Chart.ToImage(System.String,System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat)
member.summary: Creates the chart image and saves it to a file in the specified format.
member.param: The image file name with full path.
The format in which to save the image.

remarks.p: The following formats are supported: .bmp, .gif, .jpg, .jpeg, .tiff, .emf.

member.param: The image file name with full path.
Jpeg quality.

The format in which to save the image.

remarks.p: The following formats are supported: .bmp, .gif, .jpg, .jpeg, .tiff, .emf.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.ChartObject

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.HidePivotFieldButtons
member.summary: Indicates whether hide the pivot chart field buttons only when the chart is PivotChart

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.PivotSource
member.summary: The source is the data of the pivotTable. If PivotSource is not empty ,the chart is PivotChart.
member.remarks: If the pivot table "PivotTable1" in the Worksheet "Sheet1" in the file "Book1.xls". The pivotSource could be "[Book1.xls]Sheet1!PivotTable1" if the chart and the PivotTable is not in the same workbook. If you set this property ,the previous data source setting will be lost.

member.summary: Represents the chart data table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.IsLegendShown
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the chart legend will be displayed. Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.IsRectangularCornered
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the chart area is rectangular cornered. Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.IsDataTableShown
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the chart displays a data table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.FirstSliceAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle of the first pie-chart or doughnut-chart slice, in degrees (clockwise from vertical). Applies only to pie, 3-D pie, and doughnut charts, 0 to 360.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.GapWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets the space between bar or column clusters, as a percentage of the bar or column width. The value of this property must be between 0 and 500.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.GapDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the data series in a 3-D chart, as a percentage of the marker width. The value of this property must be between 0 and 500.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.Floor
member.summary: Returns a object that represents the walls of a 3-D chart.
member.remarks: This property doesn't apply to 3-D pie charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.Walls
member.summary: Returns a object that represents the walls of a 3-D chart.
member.remarks: This property doesn't apply to 3-D pie charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.WallsAndGridlines2D
member.summary: True if gridlines are drawn two-dimensionally on a 3-D chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.Rotation
member.summary: Represents the rotation of the 3-D chart view (the rotation of the plot area around the z-axis, in degrees).
member.remarks: The value of this property must be from 0 to 360, except for 3-D bar charts, where the value must be from 0 to 44. The default value is 20. Applies only to 3-D charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.Elevation
member.summary: Represents the elevation of the 3-D chart view, in degrees.
member.remarks: The chart elevation is the height at which you view the chart, in degrees. The default is 15 for most chart types. The value of this property must be between -90 and 90, except for 3-D bar charts, where it must be between 0 and 44.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.RightAngleAxes
member.summary: True if the chart axes are at right angles.Applies only for 3-D charts(except Column3D and 3-D Pie Charts).
member.remarks: If this property is True, the Perspective property is ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.AutoSacling
member.summary: True if Microsoft Excel scales a 3-D chart so that it's closer in size to the equivalent 2-D chart. The RightAngleAxes property must be True.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.HeightPercent
member.summary: Returns or sets the height of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 5 and 500 percent).

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.Perspective
member.summary: Returns or sets the perspective for the 3-D chart view. Must be between 0 and 100. This property is ignored if the RightAngleAxes property is True.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.DepthPercent
member.summary: Represents the depth of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 20 and 2000 percent).

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Chart.MajorGridLines
member.summary: Represents major gridlines on a chart axis.
member.remarks: /// NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, you should use for the same purpose. It will be removed 12 months later since release 2.7.1 in December 2004. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

members.member:
Represents a single column in a worksheet.
NOTE: This class is now obsolete. It will be removed 12 months later since the fix 4.4.1.8 in March 2008. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced. [Obsolete]

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Column.ApplyStyle(Aspose.Cells.Style,Aspose.Cells.StyleFlag)
member.summary: Applies formattings for a whole column.
member.param: The style object which will be applied.
Flags which indicates applied formatting properties.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Column.Index
member.summary: Gets the index of this column.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Column.Style
member.summary: Gets the style of this column.
member.remarks: You have to call Column.ApplyStyle() method to save your changing with the row style, otherwise it will not effect.

members.member:
Collects the objects that represent the individual columns in a worksheet.
If a column has a default setting, it will not occur in this collection. However, you can directly access a column by the indexer of this collection. And this column will be created and reserved in the collection. NOTE: This class is now obsolete. It will be removed 12 months later since the fix 4.4.1.8 in March 2008. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced. [Obsolete]

members.member:

This property will be removed 12 months later since October 2008. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced. [Obsolete("Use DataLables.Position property instead.")]

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.FillFormat
member.summary: Encapsulates the object that represents fill formatting for a shape.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.FillFormat.SetOneColorGradient(System.Drawing.Color,System.Double,Aspose.Cells.GradientStyleType,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the specified fill to a one-color gradient.
member.param: One gradient color.
The gradient degree. Can be a value from 0.0 (dark) through 1.0 (light).
Gradient shading style.

The gradient variant. Can be a value from 1 through 4, corresponding to one of the four variants on the Gradient tab in the Fill Effects dialog box. If style is GradientStyle.FromCenter, the Variant argument can only be 1 or 2.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.FillFormat.SetTwoColorGradient(System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color,Aspose.Cells.GradientStyleType,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the specified fill to a two-color gradient.
member.param: One gradient color.
Two gradient color.
Gradient shading style.

The gradient variant. Can be a value from 1 through 4, corresponding to one of the four variants on the Gradient tab in the Fill Effects dialog box. If style is GradientStyle.FromCenter, the Variant argument can only be 1 or 2.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.FillFormat.SetPresetColorGradient(Aspose.Cells.GradientPresetType,Aspose.Cells.GradientStyleType,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the specified fill to a preset-color gradient.
member.param: Preset color type
Gradient shading style.

The gradient variant. Can be a value from 1 through 4, corresponding to one of the four variants on the Gradient tab in the Fill Effects dialog box. If style is GradientStyle.FromCenter, the Variant argument can only be 1 or 2.

member.summary: Returns the gradient variant for the the specified fill.

member.summary: Gets and sets the conditional format operator type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.StopIfTrue
member.summary: If this true, no rules with lower priority may be applied over this rule, when this rule evaluates to true. Only applies for Excel 2007;

member.summary: Gets or setts style of conditional formatted cell ranges.

member.summary: Gets and sets whether the conditional format Type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.IconSet
member.summary: Get the conditional formatting's "IconSet" instance. The default instance's IconSetType is TrafficLights31. Valid only for type = IconSet.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.DataBar
member.summary: Get the conditional formatting's "DataBar" instance. The default instance's color is blue. Valid only for type = DataBar.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.ColorScale
member.summary: Get the conditional formatting's "ColorScale" instance. The default instance is a "green-yellow-red" 3ColorScale . Valid only for type = ColorScale.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.Top10
member.summary: Get the conditional formatting's "Top10" instance. The default instance's rule highlights cells whose values fall in the top 10 bracket. Valid only for type = Top10.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.AboveAverage
member.summary: Get the conditional formatting's "AboveAverage" instance. The default instance's rule highlights cells that are above the average for all values in the range. Valid only for type = AboveAverage.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.Text
member.summary: The text value in a "text contains" conditional formatting rule. Valid only for type = containsText, notContainsText, beginsWith and endsWith. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.FormatCondition.TimePeriod
member.summary: The applicable time period in a "date occurring" conditional formatting rule. Valid only for type = timePeriod. The default value is TimePeriodType.Today.

member.summary: Get or set this ColorScale's mid value object. Cannot set CFValueObject with type FormatConditionValueType.Max or FormatConditionValueType.Min to it.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ColorScale.MaxCfvo
member.summary: Get or set this ColorScale's max value object. Cannot set null or CFValueObject with type FormatConditionValueType.Min to it.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ColorScale.MinColor
member.summary: Get or set the min value object's corresponding color.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ColorScale.MidColor
member.summary: Get or set the mid value object's corresponding color.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ColorScale.MaxColor
member.summary: Get or set the max value object's corresponding color.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.AboveAverage
member.summary: Describe the AboveAverage conditional formatting rule. This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are above or below the average for all values in the range.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AboveAverage.IsAboveAverage
member.summary: Get or set the flag indicating whether the rule is an "above average" rule. 'true' indicates 'above average'. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AboveAverage.IsEqualAverage
member.summary: Get or set the flag indicating whether the 'aboveAverage' and 'belowAverage' criteria is inclusive of the average itself, or exclusive of that value. 'true' indicates to include the average value in the criteria. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AboveAverage.StdDev
member.summary: Get or set the number of standard deviations to include above or below the average in the conditional formatting rule. The input value must between 0 and 3 (include 0 and 3). Setting this value to 0 means stdDev is not set. The default value is 0.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Top10
member.summary: Describe the Top10 conditional formatting rule. This conditional formatting rule highlights cells whose values fall in the top N or bottom N bracket, as specified.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Top10.IsPercent
member.summary: Get or set the flag indicating whether a "top/bottom n" rule is a "top/bottom n percent" rule. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Top10.IsBottom
member.summary: Get or set the flag indicating whether a "top/bottom n" rule is a "bottom n" rule. '1' indicates 'bottom'. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Top10.Rank
member.summary: Get or set the value of "n" in a "top/bottom n" conditional formatting rule. If IsPercent is true, the value must between 0 and 100. Otherwise it must between 0 and 1000. Default value is 10.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.DataBar
member.summary: Describe the DataBar conditional formatting rule. This conditional formatting rule displays a gradated data bar in the range of cells.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.DataBar.MinCfvo
member.summary: Get or set this DataBar's min value object. Cannot set null or CFValueObject with type FormatConditionValueType.Max to it.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.DataBar.MaxCfvo
member.summary: Get or set this DataBar's max value object. Cannot set null or CFValueObject with type FormatConditionValueType.Min to it.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.DataBar.Color
member.summary: Get or set this DataBar's Color.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.DataBar.ShowValue
member.summary: Get or set the flag indicating whether to show the values of the cells on which this data bar is applied. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.IconSet.ShowValue
member.summary: Get or set the flag indicating whether to show the values of the cells on which this icon set is applied. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.IconSet.Reverse
member.summary: Get or set the flag indicating whether to reverses the default order of the icons in this icon set. Default value is false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType
member.summary: Conditional format rule type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.CellValue
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule compares a cell value to a formula calculated result, using an operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.Expression
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule contains a formula to evaluate. When the formula result is true, the cell is highlighted.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.ColorScale
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule creates a gradated color scale on the cells.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.DataBar
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule displays a gradated data bar in the range of cells.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.IconSet
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule applies icons to cells according to their values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.Top10
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells whose values fall in the top N or bottom N bracket, as specified.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.UniqueValues
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights unique values in the range.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.DuplicateValues
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights duplicated values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.ContainsText
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells containing given text. Equivalent to using the SEARCH() sheet function to determine whether the cell contains the text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.NotContainsText
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are not blank. Equivalent of using LEN(TRIM()). This means that if the cell contains only characters that TRIM() would remove, then it is considered blank. An empty cell is also considered blank.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.BeginsWith
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells in the range that begin with the given text. Equivalent to using the LEFT() sheet function and comparing values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.EndsWith
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells ending with given text. Equivalent to using the RIGHT() sheet function and comparing values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.ContainsBlanks
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are completely blank. Equivalent of using LEN(TRIM()). This means that if the cell contains only characters that TRIM() would remove, then it is considered blank. An empty cell is also considered blank.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.NotContainsBlanks
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are not blank. Equivalent of using LEN(TRIM()). This means that if the cell contains only characters that TRIM() would remove, then it is considered blank. An empty cell is also considered blank.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.ContainsErrors
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells with formula errors. Equivalent to using ISERROR() sheet function to determine if there is a formula error.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.NotContainsErrors
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells without formula errors. Equivalent to using ISERROR() sheet function to determine if there is a formula error.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.TimePeriod
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells containing dates in the specified time period. The underlying value of the cell is evaluated, therefore the cell does not need to be formatted as a date to be evaluated. For example, with a cell containing the value 38913 the conditional format shall be applied if the rule requires a value of 7/14/2006.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.AboveAverage
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are above or below the average for all values in the range.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType
member.summary: Condition value type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Formula
member.summary: The minimum/ midpoint / maximum value for the gradient is determined by a formula.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Max
member.summary: Indicates that the maximum value in the range shall be used as the maximum value for the gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Min
member.summary: Indicates that the minimum value in the range shall be used as the minimum value for the gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Number
member.summary: Indicates that the minimum / midpoint / maximum value for the gradient is specified by a constant numeric value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Percent
member.summary: Value indicates a percentage between the minimum and maximum values in the range shall be used as the minimum / midpoint / maximum value for the gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Percentile
member.summary: Value indicates a percentile ranking in the range shall be used as the minimum / midpoint / maximum value for the gradient.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.ICustomFunction
member.summary: Allows users to add their custom formula calculation functions to extend the calculation engine.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.ICustomFunction.CalculateCustomFunction(System.String,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Calculates the result of custom function.
member.param: Custom function name, such as "MyFunc1".
A list of parameters value for custom functions.
A list of context objects.
member.remarks:
Currently there are 3 fixed context objects and some varialbe context objects:
1. Current Workbook object.
2. Current Worksheet object.
3. Current Cell object.
Others are custom function parameters text. If a custom function name is not supported, please return a null reference.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.summary: Encapsulates a collection of objects.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.NSeries.AddR1C1(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds the collection to a chart.
member.param: Specifies values from which to plot the data series
Specifies whether to plot the series from a range of cell values by row or by column.
member.returns: Return the first index of the added ASeries in the NSeries.

remarks.br: If set data on contiguous cells, use colon to seperate them.For example, R[1]C[1]:R[3]C[2].
If set data on contiguous cells, use comma to seperate them.For example,R[1]C[1],R[3]C[2].

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.NSeries.Add(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds the collection to a chart.
member.param: Specifies values from which to plot the data series
Specifies whether to plot the series from a range of cell values by row or by column.
member.returns: Return the first index of the added ASeries in the NSeries.

remarks.br: If set data on contiguous cells, use colon to seperate them.For example, C2:C5.
If set data on contiguous cells, use comma to seperate them.For example, C2,D5.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup
member.summary: Encapsulates the object that represents the page setup description. The PageSetup object contains all page setup options.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.GetHeader(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a script formatting the header of an Excel file.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.GetFooter(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a script formatting the footer of an Excel file.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.SetHeader(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a script formatting the header of an Excel file.
member.param: Header format script.
member.remarks:
Script commands:
Command
Description
&P Current page number
&N Page count
&D Current date
&T Current time
&A Sheet name
&F File name without path
&"<FontName>" Font name, for exampe: &"Arial"
&"<FontName>, <FontStyle>" Font name and font style, for exampe: &"Arial,Bold"
&<FontSize> Font size.If this command is followed by a plain number to be printed in the header, it will be separated from the font height with a space character.
&G Image script
For example: "&Arial,Bold&8Header Note"

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.SetFooter(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a script formatting the footer of an Excel file.
member.param: Footer format script.
member.remarks:
Script commands:
Command
Description
&P Current page number
&N Page count
&D Current date
&T Current time
&A Sheet name
&F File name without path
&"<FontName>" Font name, for exampe: &"Arial"
&"<FontName>, <FontStyle>" Font name and font style, for exampe: &"Arial,Bold"
&<FontSize> Font size.If this command is followed by a plain number to be printed in the header, it will be separated from the font height with a space character.
&G Image script
For example: "&Arial,Bold&8Footer Note"

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.SetEvenHeader(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a script formatting the even page header of an Excel file. Only effect in Excel 2007 when IsHFDiffOddEven is true.
member.param: Header format script.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.PrintTitleColumns
member.summary: Represents the columns that contain the cells to be repeated on the left side of each page.

example.code:
[C#]
cells.PageSetup.PrintTitleColumns = "$A:$A";
[Visula Basic]
cells.PageSetup.PrintTitleColumns = "$A:$A"

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.PrintTitleRows
member.summary: Represents the rows that contain the cells to be repeated at the top of each page.

example.code:
[C#]
cells.PageSetup.PrintTitleRows = "$1:$1";
[Visula Basic]
cells.PageSetup.PrintTitleRows = "$1:$1"

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Protection
member.summary: Represents the various types of protection options available for a worksheet. Only used in ExcelXP and above version.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsDeletingColumnsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the deletion of columns is allowed on a protected worksheet.
member.remarks: The columns containing the cells to be deleted must be unlocked when the sheet is protected, and "Select unlocked cells" option must be enabled.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsDeletingRowsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the deletion of rows is allowed on a protected worksheet.
member.remarks: The rows containing the cells to be deleted must be unlocked when the sheet is protected, and "Select unlocked cells" option must be enabled.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsFilteringAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the user is allowed to make use of an AutoFilter that was created before the sheet was protected.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsFormattingCellsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the formatting of cells is allowed on a protected worksheet.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsFormattingColumnsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the formatting of columns is allowed on a protected worksheet

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsFormattingRowsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the formatting of rows is allowed on a protected worksheet

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsInsertingColumnsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the insertion of columns is allowed on a protected worksheet

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsInsertingHyperlinksAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the insertion of hyperlinks is allowed on a protected worksheet

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsInsertingRowsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the insertion of rows is allowed on a protected worksheet

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsSortingAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the sorting option is allowed on a protected worksheet.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsUsingPivotTablesAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the user is allowed to manipulate pivot tables on a protected worksheet.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsEditingContentsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the user is allowed to edit contents of locked cells on a protected worksheet.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsEditingObjectsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the user is allowed to manipulate drawing objects on a protected worksheet.

member.summary: Represents if the user is allowed to edit scenarios on a protected worksheet.

member.summary: Returns a Range object that represents the rectangular intersection of two ranges.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Range.Merge
member.summary: Combines a range of cells into a single cell.
member.remarks: Reference the merged cell via the address of the upper-left cell in the range.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Range.UnMerge
member.summary: Unmerges merged cells of this range.

member.summary: Applies formattings for a whole range.
member.param: The style object which will be applied.
Flags which indicates applied formatting properties.
member.remarks: Each cell in this range will contains a object. So this is a memory-consuming method. Please use it carefully.

Style can only be get or set a whole to a range of cells. If not set, get property will retun null. NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, you should use for the same purpose. member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Workbook
member.summary: Represents a root object to create an Excel spreadsheet.
member.remarks: The Workbook class denotes an Excel spreadsheet. Each spreadsheet can contain multiple worksheets. The basic feature of the class is to open and save native excel files. The class has some advanced features like copying data from other Workbooks, combining two Workbooks and protecting the Excel spreadsheet.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Workbook.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.example:
The following code shows how to use the Workbook constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the class.
[C#]
Workbook workbook = new Workbook();
[Visual Basic]
Dim workbook as Workbook = new Workbook()

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Workbook.ChangePalette(System.Drawing.Color,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the palette for the spreadsheet in the specified index.
member.param: Color structure.
Palette index, 0 - 55.
member.remarks:
The palette has 56 entries, each represented by an RGB value. If you set a color which is not in the palette, it will not take effect. So if you want to set a custom color, please change the palette at first.
The following is the standard color palette.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Workbook.CalculateFormula
member.summary: Calculates the result of formulas.
member.remarks:
This method does not support formulas with external links to other files.
Now Workbook built-in functions supported in this method:
[A]
ABS, ACOS, ACOSH, ADDRESS, AND, ASIN, ASINH, ATAN, ATAN2, ATANH, AVERAGE
[B] BETADIST, BETAINV, BINOMDIST
[C]
CEILING, CELL, CHOOSE, CHAR, COLUMN, COLUMNS, CORREL, CONCATENATE, COS, COSH, COUNT, COUNTA, COUNTBLANK, COUNTIF
[D]
DATE, DATEDIF, DATEVALUE, DAY, DAYS360, DOLLAR
[E]
EOMONTH, EXACT, EXP, EXPONDIST
[F]
FIND, FIXED, FLOOR, FV
[H]
HLOOKUP
[I]
IF, IFERROR, INDEX, INDIRECT, INT, IPMT, IRR, ISBLANK, ISERR, ISERROR, ISNA, ISNUMBER, ISREF
[L]
LEFT, LEN, LINEST, LN, LOG10, LOOKUP
[M]
MATCH, MAX, MEDIAN, MID, MIN, MOD, MONTH, MROUND
[N]
NA, NORMDIST, NORMINV, NORMSDIST, NORMSINV, NOT, NOW, NPV
[O]
OFFSET, OR
[P]
PEARSON, PERCENTILE, PI, PMT, POWER, POISSON, PPMT, PRODUCT, PV
[Q]
QUARTILE
[R]
RAND, RANDBETWEEN, RANK, RATE, REPT, RIGHT, ROUND, ROUNDDOWN, ROUNDUP, ROW, ROWS, RSQ
[S]
SEARCH, SIGN, SIN, SINH, SMALL, SQRT, STDEV, SUBSTITUTE, SUBTOTAL, SUM, SUMIF, SUMPRODUCT
[T]
TAN, TANH, TEXT, TIME, TODAY, TRUNC
[U]
UPPER
[V]
VALUE, VLOOKUP
[X]
XIRR
[Y]
YEAR, YEARFRAC
And Aspose.Cells supports the following add-in functions:
MCORRELS, REGRESSN

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Worksheet.FreezePanes(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Freezes panes at the specified cell in the worksheet.
member.param: Row index.
Column index.
Number of visible rows in top pane, no more than row index.
Number of visible columns in left pane, no more than column index.

remarks.p: Row index and column index cannot all be zero. Number of rows and number of columns also cannot all be zero.
The first two parameters specify the freezed position and the last two parameters specify the area freezed on the left top pane.

member.summary: Protects worksheet.

Password.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Worksheets.BuiltInDocumentProperties
member.summary: Returns a DocumentProperties collection that represents all the built-in document properties of the spreadsheet.
member.remarks:
A new property cannot be added to built-in document properties list. You can only get a built-in property and change its value. The following is the built-in properties name list:
Title
Subject
Author
Keywords
Comments
Template
Last Author
Revision Number
Application Name
Last Print Date
Creation Date
Last Save Time
Total Editing Time
Number of Pages
Number of Words
Number of Characters
Security
Category
Format
Manager
Company
Number of Bytes
Number of Lines
Number of Paragraphs
Number of Slides
Number of Notes
Number of Hidden Slides
Number of Multimedia Clips

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Worksheets.CustomDocumentProperties
member.summary: Returns a DocumentProperties collection that represents all the custom document properties of the spreadsheet.

example.code:
[C#] excel.Worksheets.CustomDocumentProperties.Add("Checked by", "Jane");
[Visual Basic] excel.Worksheets.CustomDocumentProperties.Add("Checked by", "Jane")
